title: Here's a reading list of 20 influential articles on retrieval-based language models up to 2023. These papers cover various aspects of retrieval-augmented models, including their architecture, training, and applications
Retrieval-Augmented Language Model Pre-Training"** - Guu et al
Retrieval-Augmented Generation for Knowledge-Intensive NLP Tasks"**
**"Dense Passage Retrieval for Open-Domain Question Answering"** - Karpukhin et al
**"Retrieval-Augmented Generation for Knowledge-Intensive NLP Tasks"**
Efficient and Effective Passage Search via Contextualized Late Interaction over BERT"**
**"Leveraging Passage Retrieval with Generative Models for Open Domain Question Answering"**
**"FiD: A Simple and Effective Baseline for Fine-tuned Dense Retrieval"**
**"T5: Exploring the Limits of Transfer Learning with a Unified Text-to-Text Transformer"**
**"Retrieval-Enhanced Transformer Models for Question Answering"** - Sachan et al
**"KILT: A Benchmark for Knowledge Intensive Language Tasks"**
**"End-to-End Open-Domain Question Answering with BERTserini"** - Yang et al
**"Open-Domain Question Answering with Pre-trained Language Models"** - Lee et al
**"Multi-Task Retrieval for Knowledge-Intensive Tasks"** - Maillard et al
**"Improving Language Models by Retrieving from Trillions of Tokens"**
**"Prompting for Retrieval-Augmented Language Models"** - Lazaridou et al
**"Memory-Augmented Neural Networks for Machine Reading and Question Answering"** - Miller et al
**"Learning to Retrieve Passages without Supervision"** - Lee et al
**"A Survey on Retrieval-Augmented Language Models"** - Thakur et al
**"Retrieval-Augmented Language Models Exceeding 100 Billion Parameters"** - Zhang et al
**"Efficient Retrieval-Augmented Generation with Mixture of Experts"** - Roller et al
These articles provide a comprehensive overview of the development and application of retrieval-based language models, highlighting key innovations and methodologies in the field
